title: Matching bases
text: Both $$\log_{2}\left(16\right)$$ and $$\log_{2}\left(x \left(x-6\right)\right)$$ containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes $$x \left(x-6\right)=16$$.

title: Solve for x
text: Given $$x \left(x-6\right)=16$$ solve for x. We can simplify it as $$x^2-6x-16=0$$. Then we can factor the quadratic and get $$\left(x-8\right) \left(x+2\right)=0$$ which gives $$x=8$$ or $$x=-2$$. Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, b can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer. Therefore $$x=8$$ is the only solution for this equation.
